intro: Sedum dioicum, commonly known as common stonecrop, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. It is a perennial species that produces both male and female flowers on separate plants, making it dioecious. Its ability to thrive in harsh environments makes it a hardy and adaptable plant.
